73 /*========== Macros and Definitions =========================================*/
74 /** default value for unset "active delay time" */
75 #define BMS_NO_ACTIVE_DELAY_TIME_ms (UINT32_MAX)
76 
77 /**
78  * Saves the last state and the last substate
79  */
80 #define BMS_SAVELASTSTATES() \
81  bms_state.laststate = bms_state.state; \
82  bms_state.lastsubstate = bms_state.substate

86 /**
87  * contains the state of the bms state machine
88  */
89 static BMS_STATE_s bms_state = {
90  .timer = 0,
91  .stateRequest = BMS_STATE_NO_REQUEST,
92  .state = BMS_STATEMACH_UNINITIALIZED,
93  .substate = BMS_ENTRY,
94  .laststate = BMS_STATEMACH_UNINITIALIZED,
95  .lastsubstate = BMS_ENTRY,
96  .triggerentry = 0u,
97  .ErrRequestCounter = 0u,
98  .initFinished = STD_NOT_OK,
99  .counter = 0u,
100  .OscillationTimeout = 0u,
101  .PrechargeTryCounter = 0u,
102  .powerPath = BMS_POWER_PATH_OPEN,
103  .closedStrings = {0u},
104  .closedPrechargeContactors = {0u},
105  .numberOfClosedStrings = 0u,
106  .deactivatedStrings = {0},
107  .firstClosedString = 0u,
108  .stringOpenTimeout = 0u,
109  .nextstringclosedtimer = 0u,
110  .stringCloseTimeout = 0u,
111  .nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY,
112  .restTimer_10ms = BS_RELAXATION_PERIOD_10ms,
113  .currentFlowState = BMS_RELAXATION,
114  .remainingDelay_ms = BMS_NO_ACTIVE_DELAY_TIME_ms,
115  .minimumActiveDelay_ms = BMS_NO_ACTIVE_DELAY_TIME_ms,
116  .transitionToErrorState = false,
117  .timeAboveContactorBreakCurrent_ms = 0u,
118  .stringToBeOpened = 0u,
119  .contactorToBeOpened = CONT_UNDEFINED,
120 };

131 /*========== Static Function Prototypes =====================================*/
132 
133 /**
134  * @brief checks the state requests that are made.
135  * @details This function checks the validity of the state requests. The
136  * results of the checked is returned immediately.
137  * @param[in] statereq state request to be checked
138  * @return result of the state request that was made
139  */
140 static BMS_RETURN_TYPE_e BMS_CheckStateRequest(BMS_STATE_REQUEST_e statereq);
141 
142 /**
143  * @brief transfers the current state request to the state machine.
144  * @details This function takes the current state request from #bms_state
145  * transfers it to the state machine. It resets the value from
146  * #bms_state to #BMS_STATE_NO_REQUEST
147  * @return current state request
148  */
149 static BMS_STATE_REQUEST_e BMS_TransferStateRequest(void);
150 
151 /**
152  * @brief re-entrance check of SYS state machine trigger function
153  * @details This function is not re-entrant and should only be called time- or
154  * event-triggered. It increments the triggerentry counter from the
155  * state variable ltc_state. It should never be called by two
156  * different processes, so if it is the case, triggerentry should
157  * never be higher than 0 when this function is called.
158  * @return retval 0 if no further instance of the function is active, 0xff
159  * else
160  */
161 static uint8_t BMS_CheckReEntrance(void);
162 
163 /**
164  * @brief Checks the state requests made to the BMS state machine.
165  * @details Checks of the state request in the database and sets this value as
166  * return value.
167  * @return requested state
168  */
169 static uint8_t BMS_CheckCanRequests(void);
170 
171 /**
172  * @brief Checks all the error flags from diagnosis module with a severity of
173  * #DIAG_FATAL_ERROR
174  * @details Checks all the error flags from diagnosis module with a severity of
175  * #DIAG_FATAL_ERROR. Furthermore, sets parameter minimumActiveDelay_ms
176  * of bms_state variable.
177  * @return true if error flag is set, otherwise false
178  */
179 static bool BMS_IsAnyFatalErrorFlagSet(void);
180 
181 /**
182  * @brief Checks if any error flag is set and handles delay until contactors
183  * need to be opened.
184  * @details Checks all the diagnosis entries with severity of #DIAG_FATAL_ERROR
185  * and handles the configured delay until the contactors need to be
186  * opened. The shortest delay is used, if multiple errors are active at
187  * once.
188  * @return #STD_NOT_OK if error detected and delay time elapsed, otherwise #STD_OK
189  */
190 static STD_RETURN_TYPE_e BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay(void);
191 
192 /**
193  * @brief Checks if the contactor feedback for a specific contactor is valid
194  * need to be opened.
195  * @details Reads error flag database entry and checks if the feedback for this
196  * specific contactor is valid or not.
197  * @return true if no error detected feedback is valid, otherwise false
198  */
199 static bool BMS_IsContactorFeedbackValid(uint8_t stringNumber, CONT_TYPE_e contactorType);

218 /**
219  * @brief Returns ID of string with highest total voltage
220  * @details This is used to close the first string when drive-off is requested.
221  * @param[in] precharge If #BMS_DO_NOT_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT,
222  * precharge availability for string is ignored.
223  * if #BMS_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT, only select
224  * string that has precharge available.
225  * @param[in] pPackValues pointer to pack values database entry
226  * @return index of string with highest voltage If no string is available,
227  * returns #BMS_NO_STRING_AVAILABLE.
228  */
229 static uint8_t BMS_GetHighestString(BMS_CONSIDER_PRECHARGE_e precharge, DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues);
230 
231 /**
232  * @brief Returns ID of string with voltage closest to first closed string voltage
233  * @details This is used to close further strings in drive.
234  * @param[in] precharge If #BMS_DO_NOT_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT,
235  * precharge availability for string is ignored.
236  * if #BMS_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT, only select
237  * string that has precharge available.
238  * @param[in] pPackValues pointer to pack values database entry
239  * @return index of string with voltage closest to the first closed string voltage.
240  * If no string is available, returns #BMS_NO_STRING_AVAILABLE.
241  */
242 static uint8_t BMS_GetClosestString(BMS_CONSIDER_PRECHARGE_e precharge, DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues);
243 
244 /**
245  * @brief Returns ID of string with lowest total voltage
246  * @details This is used to close the first string when charge-off is requested.
247  *
248  * @param[in] precharge If 0, precharge availability for string is ignored.
249  * If 1, only selects a string that has precharge
250  * available.
251  * @param[in] pPackValues pointer to pack values database entry
252  * @return index of string with lowest voltage. If no string is available,
253  * returns #BMS_NO_STRING_AVAILABLE.
254  */
255 static uint8_t BMS_GetLowestString(BMS_CONSIDER_PRECHARGE_e precharge, DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues);
256 
257 /**
258  * @brief Returns voltage difference between first closed string and
259  * string ID
260  * @details This function is used to check voltage when trying to close further
261  * strings.
262  * @param[in] string ID of string that must be compared with first closed
263  * string
264  * @param[in] pPackValues pointer to pack values database entry
265  * @return voltage difference in mV, will return INT32_MAX if voltages are
266  * invalid and difference can not be calculated
267  */
268 static int32_t BMS_GetStringVoltageDifference(uint8_t string, const DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues);
269 
270 /**
271  * @brief Returns the average current flowing through all strings.
272  * @details This function is used when closing strings.
273  * @param[in] pPackValues pointer to pack values database entry
274  * @return average current taking all strings into account in mA. INT32_MAX if there is no valid current measurement
275  */
276 static int32_t BMS_GetAverageStringCurrent(DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues);

278 /**
279  * @brief Updates battery system state variable depending on measured/recent

282  */
283 static void BMS_UpdateBatsysState(DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues);

285 /**
286  * @brief Get first string contactor that should be opened depending on the
287  * actual current flow direction
288  * @details Check the mounting direction of the contactors and open the
289  * contactor that is mounted in the preferred current flow direction.
290  * Open the plus contactor first if, there is no contactor in
291  * preferred direction to the curren flow to open available. This may
292  * be either because both contactors are installed in the same
293  * direction or because the contactors are bidirectional.
294  * @param stringNumber string that will be opened
295  * @param flowDirection current flow direction (charging or discharging)
296  * @return #CONT_TYPE_e contactor that should be opened
297  */
298 static CONT_TYPE_e BMS_GetFirstContactorToBeOpened(uint8_t stringNumber, BMS_CURRENT_FLOW_STATE_e flowDirection);
299 
300 /**
301  * @brief Get second string contactor that should be opened
302  * @details Mounting direction of the contactor does not need to be checked
303  * for the second contactor as the current has already been
304  * interrupted opening the first contactor.
305  * @param stringNumber string that will be opened
306  * @param firstOpenedContactorType type of first contactor that has been opened
307  * @return #CONT_TYPE_e contactor that should be opened
308  */
309 static CONT_TYPE_e BMS_GetSecondContactorToBeOpened(uint8_t stringNumber, CONT_TYPE_e firstOpenedContactorType);
310 
311 /*========== Static Function Implementations ================================*/
312 
313 static BMS_RETURN_TYPE_e BMS_CheckStateRequest(BMS_STATE_REQUEST_e statereq) {
314  if (statereq == BMS_STATE_ERROR_REQUEST) {
315  return BMS_OK;
316  }
317 
318  if (bms_state.stateRequest == BMS_STATE_NO_REQUEST) {
319  /* init only allowed from the uninitialized state */
320  if (statereq == BMS_STATE_INIT_REQUEST) {
321  if (bms_state.state == BMS_STATEMACH_UNINITIALIZED) {
322  return BMS_OK;
323  } else {
324  return BMS_ALREADY_INITIALIZED;
325  }
326  } else {
327  return BMS_ILLEGAL_REQUEST;
328  }
329  } else {
330  return BMS_REQUEST_PENDING;
331  }
332 }
333 
334 static uint8_t BMS_CheckReEntrance(void) {
335  uint8_t retval = 0;
336  OS_EnterTaskCritical();
337  if (!bms_state.triggerentry) {
338  bms_state.triggerentry++;
339  } else {
340  retval = 0xFF; /* multiple calls of function */
341  }
342  OS_ExitTaskCritical();
343  return retval;
344 }
345 
346 static BMS_STATE_REQUEST_e BMS_TransferStateRequest(void) {
347  BMS_STATE_REQUEST_e retval = BMS_STATE_NO_REQUEST;
348 
349  OS_EnterTaskCritical();
350  retval = bms_state.stateRequest;
351  bms_state.stateRequest = BMS_STATE_NO_REQUEST;
352  OS_ExitTaskCritical();
353  return retval;
354 }
355 
356 static void BMS_GetMeasurementValues(void) {
357  DATA_READ_DATA(&bms_tablePackValues, &bms_tableOpenWire, &bms_tableMinMax);
358 }
359 
360 static uint8_t BMS_CheckCanRequests(void) {
361  uint8_t retVal = BMS_REQ_ID_NOREQ;
362  DATA_BLOCK_STATE_REQUEST_s request = {.header.uniqueId = DATA_BLOCK_ID_STATE_REQUEST};
363 
364  DATA_READ_DATA(&request);
365 
366  if (request.stateRequestViaCan == BMS_REQ_ID_STANDBY) {
367  retVal = BMS_REQ_ID_STANDBY;
368  } else if (request.stateRequestViaCan == BMS_REQ_ID_NORMAL) {
369  retVal = BMS_REQ_ID_NORMAL;
370  } else if (request.stateRequestViaCan == BMS_REQ_ID_CHARGE) {
371  retVal = BMS_REQ_ID_CHARGE;
372  } else if (request.stateRequestViaCan == BMS_REQ_ID_NOREQ) {
373  retVal = BMS_REQ_ID_NOREQ;
374  } else {
375  /* invalid or no request, default to BMS_REQ_ID_NOREQ (already set) */
376  }
377 
378  return retVal;
379 }
380 
381 static void BMS_CheckOpenSenseWire(void) {
382  uint8_t openWireDetected = 0;
383 
384  for (uint8_t s = 0u; s < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS; s++) {
385  /* Iterate over all modules */
386  for (uint8_t m = 0u; m < BS_NR_OF_MODULES_PER_STRING; m++) {
387  /* Iterate over all voltage sense wires: cells per module + 1 */
388  for (uint8_t wire = 0u; wire < (BS_NR_OF_CELL_BLOCKS_PER_MODULE + 1); wire++) {
389  /* open wire detected */
390  if (bms_tableOpenWire.openWire[s][(wire + (m * (BS_NR_OF_CELL_BLOCKS_PER_MODULE + 1))) == 1] > 0u) {
391  openWireDetected++;
392 
393  /* Add additional error handling here */
394  }
395  }
396  }
397  /* Set error if open wire detected */
398  if (openWireDetected == 0u) {
399  DIAG_Handler(DIAG_ID_AFE_OPEN_WIRE, DIAG_EVENT_OK, DIAG_STRING, s);
400  } else {
401  DIAG_Handler(DIAG_ID_AFE_OPEN_WIRE, DIAG_EVENT_NOT_OK, DIAG_STRING, s);
402  }
403  }
404 }
405 
406 static STD_RETURN_TYPE_e BMS_CheckPrecharge(uint8_t stringNumber, const DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues) {
407  STD_RETURN_TYPE_e retVal = STD_NOT_OK;
408  /* make sure that we do not access the arrays in the database
409  tables out of bounds */
410  FAS_ASSERT(stringNumber < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS);
411  FAS_ASSERT(pPackValues != NULL_PTR);
412 
413  /* Only check precharging if current value and voltages are valid */
414  if ((pPackValues->invalidStringCurrent[stringNumber] == 0u)) {
415  /* Only current not current direction is checked */
416  const int32_t current_mA = MATH_AbsInt32_t(pPackValues->stringCurrent_mA[stringNumber]);
417 
418  /* Check if precharging has been successful */
419  if (current_mA < BMS_PRECHARGE_CURRENT_THRESHOLD_mA) {
420  retVal = STD_OK;
421 
422  (void)DIAG_Handler(DIAG_ID_PRECHARGE_ABORT_REASON_CURRENT, DIAG_EVENT_OK, DIAG_STRING, stringNumber);
423  } else {
424  if (current_mA >= BMS_PRECHARGE_CURRENT_THRESHOLD_mA) {
425  /* Current flow too high */
426  (void)DIAG_Handler(
427  DIAG_ID_PRECHARGE_ABORT_REASON_CURRENT, DIAG_EVENT_NOT_OK, DIAG_STRING, stringNumber);
428  }
429  retVal = STD_NOT_OK;
430  }
431  }
432  return retVal;
433 }
434 
435 static bool BMS_IsAnyFatalErrorFlagSet(void) {
436  bool fatalErrorActive = false;
437 
438  for (uint16_t entry = 0u; entry < diag_device.numberOfFatalErrors; entry++) {
439  const STD_RETURN_TYPE_e diagnosisState =
440  DIAG_GetDiagnosisEntryState(diag_device.pFatalErrorLinkTable[entry]->id);
441  if (STD_NOT_OK == diagnosisState) {
442  /* Fatal error detected -> get delay of this error until contactors shall be opened */
443  const uint32_t kDelay_ms = DIAG_GetDelay(diag_device.pFatalErrorLinkTable[entry]->id);
444  /* Check if delay of detected failure is smaller than the delay of a previously detected failure */
445  if (bms_state.minimumActiveDelay_ms > kDelay_ms) {
446  bms_state.minimumActiveDelay_ms = kDelay_ms;
447  }
448  fatalErrorActive = true;
449  }
450  }
451  return fatalErrorActive;
452 }
453 
454 static STD_RETURN_TYPE_e BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay(void) {
455  STD_RETURN_TYPE_e retVal = STD_OK; /* is set to STD_NOT_OK if error detected */
456  static uint32_t previousTimestamp = 0u;
457  uint32_t timestamp = OS_GetTickCount();
458 
459  /* Check if any fatal error is detected */
460  const bool isErrorActive = BMS_IsAnyFatalErrorFlagSet();
461 
462  /** Check if a fatal error has been detected previously. If yes, check delay */
463  if (bms_state.transitionToErrorState == true) {
464  /* Decrease active delay since last call */
465  const uint32_t timeSinceLastCall_ms = timestamp - previousTimestamp;
466  if (timeSinceLastCall_ms <= bms_state.remainingDelay_ms) {
467  bms_state.remainingDelay_ms -= timeSinceLastCall_ms;
468  } else {
469  bms_state.remainingDelay_ms = 0u;
470  }
471 
472  /* Check if delay from a new error is shorter then active delay from
473  * previously detected error in BMS statemachine */
474  if (bms_state.remainingDelay_ms >= bms_state.minimumActiveDelay_ms) {
475  bms_state.remainingDelay_ms = bms_state.minimumActiveDelay_ms;
476  }
477  } else {
478  /* Delay is not active, check if it should be activated */
479  if (isErrorActive == true) {
480  bms_state.transitionToErrorState = true;
481  bms_state.remainingDelay_ms = bms_state.minimumActiveDelay_ms;
482  }
483  }
484 
485  /** Set previous timestamp for next call */
486  previousTimestamp = timestamp;
487 
488  /* Check if bms statemachine should switch to error state. This is the case
489  * if the delay is activated and the remaining delay is down to 0 */
490  if ((bms_state.transitionToErrorState == true) && (bms_state.remainingDelay_ms == 0u)) {
491  retVal = STD_NOT_OK;
492  }
493 
494  return retVal;
495 }
496 
497 static bool BMS_IsContactorFeedbackValid(uint8_t stringNumber, CONT_TYPE_e contactorType) {
498  FAS_ASSERT(stringNumber < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS);
499  FAS_ASSERT(contactorType != CONT_UNDEFINED);
500  bool feedbackValid = false;
501  /* Read latest error flags from database */
502  DATA_BLOCK_ERROR_STATE_s tableErrorFlags = {.header.uniqueId = DATA_BLOCK_ID_ERROR_STATE};
503  DATA_READ_DATA(&tableErrorFlags);
504  /* Check if contactor feedback is valid */
505  switch (contactorType) {
506  case CONT_PLUS:
507  if (tableErrorFlags.contactorInPositivePathOfStringFeedbackError[stringNumber] == false) {
508  feedbackValid = true;
509  }
510  break;
511  case CONT_MINUS:
512  if (tableErrorFlags.contactorInNegativePathOfStringFeedbackError[stringNumber] == false) {
513  feedbackValid = true;
514  }
515  break;
516  case CONT_PRECHARGE:
517  if (tableErrorFlags.prechargeContactorFeedbackError[stringNumber] == false) {
518  feedbackValid = true;
519  }
520  break;
521  default:
522  /* CONT_UNDEFINED already prevent via assert */
523  break;
524  }
525  return feedbackValid;
526 }
527 
528 static uint8_t BMS_GetHighestString(BMS_CONSIDER_PRECHARGE_e precharge, DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues) {
529  FAS_ASSERT(pPackValues != NULL_PTR);
530  uint8_t highest_string_index = BMS_NO_STRING_AVAILABLE;
531  int32_t max_stringVoltage_mV = INT32_MIN;
532 
533  for (uint8_t s = 0u; s < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS; s++) {
534  if ((pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[s] >= max_stringVoltage_mV) &&
535  (pPackValues->invalidStringVoltage[s] == 0u)) {
536  if (bms_state.deactivatedStrings[s] == 0u) {
537  if (precharge == BMS_DO_NOT_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT) {
538  max_stringVoltage_mV = pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[s];
539  highest_string_index = s;
540  } else {
541  if (bs_stringsWithPrecharge[s] == BS_STRING_WITH_PRECHARGE) {
542  max_stringVoltage_mV = pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[s];
543  highest_string_index = s;
544  }
545  }
546  }
547  }
548  }
549 
550  return highest_string_index;
551 }
552 
553 static uint8_t BMS_GetClosestString(BMS_CONSIDER_PRECHARGE_e precharge, DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues) {
554  FAS_ASSERT(pPackValues != NULL_PTR);
555  uint8_t closestStringIndex = BMS_NO_STRING_AVAILABLE;
556  int32_t closedStringVoltage_mV = 0;
557  bool searchString = false;
558 
559  /* Get voltage of first closed string */
560  if (pPackValues->invalidStringVoltage[bms_state.firstClosedString] == 0u) {
561  closedStringVoltage_mV = pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[bms_state.firstClosedString];
562  searchString = true;
563  } else if (pPackValues->invalidHvBusVoltage == 0u) {
564  /* Use high voltage bus voltage if measured string voltage is invalid */
565  closedStringVoltage_mV = pPackValues->highVoltageBusVoltage_mV;
566  searchString = true;
567  } else {
568  /* Do not search for next string if no valid voltages could be measured */
569  searchString = false;
570  }
571 
572  if (searchString == true) {
573  for (uint8_t s = 0u; s < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS; s++) {
574  const bool isStringClosed = BMS_IsStringClosed(s);
575  const uint8_t isStringVoltageValid = pPackValues->invalidStringVoltage[s];
576  if ((isStringClosed == false) && (isStringVoltageValid == 0u)) {
577  /* Only check open strings with valid voltages */
578  int32_t minimumVoltageDifference_mV = INT32_MAX;
579  int32_t voltageDifference_mV = labs(closedStringVoltage_mV - pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[s]);
580  if (voltageDifference_mV <= minimumVoltageDifference_mV) {
581  if (bms_state.deactivatedStrings[s] == 0u) {
582  if (precharge == BMS_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT) {
583  if (bs_stringsWithPrecharge[s] == BS_STRING_WITH_PRECHARGE) {
584  minimumVoltageDifference_mV = voltageDifference_mV;
585  closestStringIndex = s;
586  }
587  } else {
588  minimumVoltageDifference_mV = voltageDifference_mV;
589  closestStringIndex = s;
590  }
591  }
592  }
593  }
594  }
595  }
596  return closestStringIndex;
597 }
598 
599 static uint8_t BMS_GetLowestString(BMS_CONSIDER_PRECHARGE_e precharge, DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues) {
600  FAS_ASSERT(pPackValues != NULL_PTR);
601  uint8_t lowest_string_index = BMS_NO_STRING_AVAILABLE;
602  int32_t min_stringVoltage_mV = INT32_MAX;
603 
604  for (uint8_t s = 0u; s < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS; s++) {
605  if ((pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[s] <= min_stringVoltage_mV) &&
606  (pPackValues->invalidStringVoltage[s] == 0u)) {
607  if (bms_state.deactivatedStrings[s] == 0u) {
608  if (precharge == BMS_DO_NOT_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT) {
609  min_stringVoltage_mV = pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[s];
610  lowest_string_index = s;
611  } else {
612  if (bs_stringsWithPrecharge[s] == BS_STRING_WITH_PRECHARGE) {
613  min_stringVoltage_mV = pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[s];
614  lowest_string_index = s;
615  }
616  }
617  }
618  }
619  }
620  return lowest_string_index;
621 }
622 
623 static int32_t BMS_GetStringVoltageDifference(uint8_t string, const DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues) {
624  FAS_ASSERT(string < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS);
625  FAS_ASSERT(pPackValues != NULL_PTR);
626  int32_t voltageDifference_mV = INT32_MAX;
627  if ((pPackValues->invalidStringVoltage[string] == 0u) &&
628  (pPackValues->invalidStringVoltage[bms_state.firstClosedString] == 0u)) {
629  /* Calculate difference between string voltages */
630  voltageDifference_mV = MATH_AbsInt32_t(
631  pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[string] - pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[bms_state.firstClosedString]);
632  } else if ((pPackValues->invalidStringVoltage[string] == 0u) && (pPackValues->invalidHvBusVoltage == 0u)) {
633  /* Calculate difference between string and high voltage bus voltage */
634  voltageDifference_mV =
635  MATH_AbsInt32_t(pPackValues->stringVoltage_mV[string] - pPackValues->highVoltageBusVoltage_mV);
636  } else {
637  /* No valid voltages for comparison -> do not calculate difference and return INT32_MAX */
638  voltageDifference_mV = INT32_MAX;
639  }
640  return voltageDifference_mV;
641 }
642 
643 static int32_t BMS_GetAverageStringCurrent(DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues) {
644  FAS_ASSERT(pPackValues != NULL_PTR);
645  int32_t average_current = pPackValues->packCurrent_mA / (int32_t)BS_NR_OF_STRINGS;
646  if (pPackValues->invalidPackCurrent == 1u) {
647  average_current = INT32_MAX;
648  }
649  return average_current;
650 }
651 
652 static void BMS_UpdateBatsysState(DATA_BLOCK_PACK_VALUES_s *pPackValues) {
653  FAS_ASSERT(pPackValues != NULL_PTR);
654 
655  /* Only update system state if current value is valid */
656  if (pPackValues->invalidPackCurrent == 0u) {
657  if (BS_POSITIVE_DISCHARGE_CURRENT == true) {
658  /* Positive current values equal a discharge of the battery system */
659  if (pPackValues->packCurrent_mA >= BS_REST_CURRENT_mA) { /* TODO: string use pack current */
660  bms_state.currentFlowState = BMS_DISCHARGING;
661  bms_state.restTimer_10ms = BS_RELAXATION_PERIOD_10ms;
662  } else if (pPackValues->packCurrent_mA <= -BS_REST_CURRENT_mA) {
663  bms_state.currentFlowState = BMS_CHARGING;
664  bms_state.restTimer_10ms = BS_RELAXATION_PERIOD_10ms;
665  } else {
666  /* Current below rest current: either battery system is at rest
667  * or the relaxation process is still ongoing */
668  if (bms_state.restTimer_10ms == 0u) {
669  /* Rest timer elapsed -> battery system at rest */
670  bms_state.currentFlowState = BMS_AT_REST;
671  } else {
672  bms_state.restTimer_10ms--;
673  bms_state.currentFlowState = BMS_RELAXATION;
674  }
675  }
676  } else {
677  /* Negative current values equal a discharge of the battery system */
678  if (pPackValues->packCurrent_mA <= -BS_REST_CURRENT_mA) {
679  bms_state.currentFlowState = BMS_DISCHARGING;
680  bms_state.restTimer_10ms = BS_RELAXATION_PERIOD_10ms;
681  } else if (pPackValues->packCurrent_mA >= BS_REST_CURRENT_mA) {
682  bms_state.currentFlowState = BMS_CHARGING;
683  bms_state.restTimer_10ms = BS_RELAXATION_PERIOD_10ms;
684  } else {
685  /* Current below rest current: either battery system is at rest
686  * or the relaxation process is still ongoing */
687  if (bms_state.restTimer_10ms == 0u) {
688  /* Rest timer elapsed -> battery system at rest */
689  bms_state.currentFlowState = BMS_AT_REST;
690  } else {
691  bms_state.restTimer_10ms--;
692  bms_state.currentFlowState = BMS_RELAXATION;
693  }
694  }
695  }
696  }
697 }
698 
699 static CONT_TYPE_e BMS_GetFirstContactorToBeOpened(uint8_t stringNumber, BMS_CURRENT_FLOW_STATE_e flowDirection) {
700  FAS_ASSERT(stringNumber < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS);
701  /* AXIVION Routine Generic-MissingParameterAssert: flowDirection: parameter accepts all defined enums */
702  CONT_TYPE_e contactorToBeOpened = CONT_UNDEFINED;
703  CONT_CURRENT_BREAKING_DIRECTION_e breakingDirection = CONT_BIDIRECTIONAL;
704  /* Required preferred opening direction dependent on the current direction */
705  if (flowDirection == BMS_CHARGING) {
706  breakingDirection = CONT_CHARGING_DIRECTION;
707  } else {
708  breakingDirection = CONT_DISCHARGING_DIRECTION;
709  }
710  /* Iterate over contactor array and search for wanted contactor */
711  uint8_t contactor = 0u;
712  for (; contactor < BS_NR_OF_CONTACTORS; contactor++) {
713  /* Search for:
714  * 1. contactor from requested string
715  * 2. contactor mounted in preferred opening direction or is bidirectional
716  * 3. is no precharge contactor */
717  bool correctString = (bool)(stringNumber == cont_contactorStates[contactor].stringIndex);
718  bool inPreferredDirection = (bool)(breakingDirection == cont_contactorStates[contactor].breakingDirection);
719  bool hasNoPreferredDirection = (bool)(cont_contactorStates[contactor].breakingDirection == CONT_BIDIRECTIONAL);
720  bool noPrechargeContactor = (bool)(cont_contactorStates[contactor].type != CONT_PRECHARGE);
721  if (correctString && noPrechargeContactor && (inPreferredDirection || hasNoPreferredDirection)) {
722  contactorToBeOpened = cont_contactorStates[contactor].type;
723  break;
724  }
725  }
726  if (contactor == BS_NR_OF_CONTACTORS) {
727  /* No contactor mounted in preferred current direction found. Select
728  * the PLUS contactor found in array cont_contactorStates from the
729  * passed string */
730  for (contactor = 0u; contactor < BS_NR_OF_CONTACTORS; contactor++) {
731  /* Search for:
732  * 1. contactor from requested string
733  * 2. is PLUS contactor */
734  if ((stringNumber == cont_contactorStates[contactor].stringIndex) &&
735  (cont_contactorStates[contactor].type == CONT_PLUS)) {
736  contactorToBeOpened = cont_contactorStates[contactor].type;
737  break;
738  }
739  }
740  }
741  if (contactor == BS_NR_OF_CONTACTORS) {
742  /* No PLUS contactor found. Select MINUS contactor found in array
743  * cont_contactorStates from the passed string */
744  for (contactor = 0u; contactor < BS_NR_OF_CONTACTORS; contactor++) {
745  /* Search for:
746  * 1. contactor from requested string
747  * 2. is PLUS contactor */
748  if ((stringNumber == cont_contactorStates[contactor].stringIndex) &&
749  (cont_contactorStates[contactor].type == CONT_MINUS)) {
750  contactorToBeOpened = cont_contactorStates[contactor].type;
751  break;
752  }
753  }
754  }
755  if (contactor == BS_NR_OF_CONTACTORS) {
756  /* No PLUS or MAIN_MINUS contactor found in requested string. */
757  FAS_ASSERT(FAS_TRAP);
758  }
759  return contactorToBeOpened;
760 }
761 
762 static CONT_TYPE_e BMS_GetSecondContactorToBeOpened(uint8_t stringNumber, CONT_TYPE_e firstOpenedContactorType) {
763  FAS_ASSERT(stringNumber < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS);
764  FAS_ASSERT((firstOpenedContactorType != CONT_UNDEFINED) && (firstOpenedContactorType != CONT_PRECHARGE));
765  CONT_TYPE_e contactorToBeOpened = CONT_UNDEFINED;
766  /* Check what contactor has already been opened and select the other one */
767  if (firstOpenedContactorType == CONT_PLUS) {
768  contactorToBeOpened = CONT_MINUS;
769  } else {
770  contactorToBeOpened = CONT_PLUS;
771  }
772  /* Iterate over contactor array and search for wanted contactor */
773  uint8_t contactor = 0u;
774  for (; contactor < BS_NR_OF_CONTACTORS; contactor++) {
775  /* Search for specific contactor from requested string */
776  if ((stringNumber == cont_contactorStates[contactor].stringIndex) &&
777  (contactorToBeOpened == cont_contactorStates[contactor].type)) {
778  contactorToBeOpened = cont_contactorStates[contactor].type;
779  break;
780  }
781  }
782  if (contactor == BS_NR_OF_CONTACTORS) {
783  /* No PLUS or MAIN_MINUS contactor found in requested string.
784  * Apparently, only one contactor has been defined for this string */
785  FAS_ASSERT(FAS_TRAP);
786  }
787  return contactorToBeOpened;
788 }
789 
790 /*========== Extern Function Implementations ================================*/
791 
792 extern STD_RETURN_TYPE_e BMS_GetInitializationState(void) {
793  return bms_state.initFinished;
794 }
795 
796 extern BMS_STATEMACH_e BMS_GetState(void) {
797  return bms_state.state;
798 }
799 
800 BMS_RETURN_TYPE_e BMS_SetStateRequest(BMS_STATE_REQUEST_e statereq) {
801  BMS_RETURN_TYPE_e retVal = BMS_OK;
802 
803  OS_EnterTaskCritical();
804  retVal = BMS_CheckStateRequest(statereq);
805 
806  if (retVal == BMS_OK) {
807  bms_state.stateRequest = statereq;
808  }
809  OS_ExitTaskCritical();
810 
811  return retVal;
812 }
813 
814 void BMS_Trigger(void) {
815  BMS_STATE_REQUEST_e statereq = BMS_STATE_NO_REQUEST;
816  DATA_BLOCK_SYSTEM_STATE_s systemstate = {.header.uniqueId = DATA_BLOCK_ID_SYSTEM_STATE};
817  uint32_t timestamp = OS_GetTickCount();
818  static uint32_t nextOpenWireCheck = 0;
819  STD_RETURN_TYPE_e retVal = STD_NOT_OK;
820  static uint8_t stringNumber = 0u;
821  static uint8_t nextStringNumber = 0u;
822  CONT_ELECTRICAL_STATE_TYPE_e contactorState = CONT_SWITCH_UNDEFINED;
823  bool contactorFeedbackValid = false;
824  STD_RETURN_TYPE_e contRetVal = STD_NOT_OK;
825 
826  if (bms_state.state != BMS_STATEMACH_UNINITIALIZED) {
827  BMS_GetMeasurementValues();
828  BMS_UpdateBatsysState(&bms_tablePackValues);
829  SOA_CheckVoltages(&bms_tableMinMax);
830  SOA_CheckTemperatures(&bms_tableMinMax, &bms_tablePackValues);
831  SOA_CheckCurrent(&bms_tablePackValues);
832  SOA_CheckSlaveTemperatures();
833  BMS_CheckOpenSenseWire();
834  CONT_CheckFeedback();
835  }
836  /* Check re-entrance of function */
837  if (BMS_CheckReEntrance() > 0u) {
838  return;
839  }
840 
841  if (bms_state.nextstringclosedtimer > 0u) {
842  bms_state.nextstringclosedtimer--;
843  }
844  if (bms_state.stringOpenTimeout > 0u) {
845  bms_state.stringOpenTimeout--;
846  }
847 
848  if (bms_state.stringCloseTimeout > 0u) {
849  bms_state.stringCloseTimeout--;
850  }
851 
852  if (bms_state.OscillationTimeout > 0u) {
853  bms_state.OscillationTimeout--;
854  }
855 
856  if (bms_state.timer > 0u) {
857  if ((--bms_state.timer) > 0u) {
858  bms_state.triggerentry--;
859  return; /* handle state machine only if timer has elapsed */
860  }
861  }
862 
863  /****Happens every time the state machine is triggered**************/
864  switch (bms_state.state) {
865  /****************************UNINITIALIZED****************************/
866  case BMS_STATEMACH_UNINITIALIZED:
867  /* waiting for Initialization Request */
868  statereq = BMS_TransferStateRequest();
869  if (statereq == BMS_STATE_INIT_REQUEST) {
870  BMS_SAVELASTSTATES();
871  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
872  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_INITIALIZATION;
873  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
874  } else if (statereq == BMS_STATE_NO_REQUEST) {
875  /* no actual request pending */
876  } else {
877  bms_state.ErrRequestCounter++; /* illegal request pending */
878  }
879  break;
880 
881  /****************************INITIALIZATION***************************/
882  case BMS_STATEMACH_INITIALIZATION:
883  BMS_SAVELASTSTATES();
884  /* Reset ALERT mode flag */
885  DIAG_Handler(DIAG_ID_ALERT_MODE, DIAG_EVENT_OK, DIAG_SYSTEM, 0u);
886  bms_state.initFinished = STD_OK;
887  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_LONGTIME;
888  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_INITIALIZED;
889  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
890  break;
891 
892  /****************************INITIALIZED******************************/
893  case BMS_STATEMACH_INITIALIZED:
894  BMS_SAVELASTSTATES();
895  if (IMD_RequestInsulationMeasurement() == IMD_ILLEGAL_REQUEST) {
896  /* Initialization of IMD device not finished yet -> wait until this is finished before moving on */
897  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_LONGTIME;
898  } else {
899  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
900  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_IDLE;
901  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
902  }
903  break;
904 
905  /****************************IDLE*************************************/
906  case BMS_STATEMACH_IDLE:
907  BMS_SAVELASTSTATES();
908 
909  if (bms_state.substate == BMS_ENTRY) {
910  DATA_READ_DATA(&systemstate);
911  systemstate.bmsCanState = BMS_CANSTATE_IDLE;
912  DATA_WRITE_DATA(&systemstate);
913  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
914  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS;
915  break;
916  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS) {
917  if (BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay() == STD_NOT_OK) {
918  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
919  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
920  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
921  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
922  break;
923  } else {
924  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
925  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS;
926  break;
927  }
928  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS) {
929  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
930  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
931  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY;
932  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
933  break;
934  }
935  break;
936 
937  /****************************OPEN CONTACTORS**************************/
938  case BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS:
939  BMS_SAVELASTSTATES();
940 
941  if (bms_state.substate == BMS_ENTRY) {
942  BAL_SetStateRequest(BAL_STATE_NO_BALANCING_REQUEST);
943  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
944  bms_state.substate = BMS_OPEN_ALL_PRECHARGES;
945  break;
946  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_OPEN_ALL_PRECHARGES) {
947  /* Precharge contactors can always be opened as the precharge
948  * resistor limits the maximum current */
949  CONT_OpenAllPrechargeContactors();
950 
951  /* Now go to string opening - open one string after another */
952  stringNumber = BS_NR_OF_STRINGS - 1u; /* Select last string */
953  bms_state.substate = BMS_OPEN_FIRST_STRING_CONTACTOR;
954  bms_state.timer = BMS_TIME_WAIT_AFTER_OPENING_PRECHARGE;
955  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_OPEN_FIRST_STRING_CONTACTOR) {
956  /* Precharge contactors have been opened -> start opening first string contactor */
957  /* TODO: Check if precharge contactors have been opened? */
958 
959  if ((bms_tablePackValues.invalidStringCurrent[stringNumber] == 0u) &&
960  (MATH_AbsInt32_t(bms_tablePackValues.stringCurrent_mA[stringNumber]) <
961  BS_MAIN_CONTACTORS_MAXIMUM_BREAK_CURRENT_mA)) {
962  /* Current is below maximum break current -> open first contactor
963  * Check the mounting direction of the contactors and open the contactor that is mounted in the
964  * preferred current flow direction. Open the plus contactor first if, there is no contactor
965  * in preferred direction to the curren flow to open available. This may be either because both
966  * contactors are installed in the same direction or because the contactors are bidirectional.
967  */
968  const BMS_CURRENT_FLOW_STATE_e flowDirection =
969  BMS_GetCurrentFlowDirection(bms_tablePackValues.stringCurrent_mA[stringNumber]);
970  bms_state.contactorToBeOpened = BMS_GetFirstContactorToBeOpened(stringNumber, flowDirection);
971  bms_state.stringToBeOpened = stringNumber;
972  /* Open first contactor */
973  CONT_OpenContactor(stringNumber, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
974  bms_state.timer = BMS_WAIT_TIME_AFTER_OPENING_STRING_CONTACTOR;
975  bms_state.substate = BMS_OPEN_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR;
976  bms_state.stringOpenTimeout = BMS_STRING_OPEN_TIMEOUT;
977  } else {
978  /* Current is above maximum contactor break current -> contactor can not be opened */
979  bms_state.timeAboveContactorBreakCurrent_ms += BMS_STATEMACHINE_TASK_CYCLE_CONTEXT_MS;
980  if (bms_state.timeAboveContactorBreakCurrent_ms > BS_MAIN_FUSE_MAXIMUM_TRIGGER_DURATION_ms) {
981  /* Fuse should have been triggered by now but apparently has not yet. Do not wait any
982  * longer. Activate ALERT mode and nevertheless start opening the contactors */
983  DIAG_Handler(DIAG_ID_ALERT_MODE, DIAG_EVENT_NOT_OK, DIAG_SYSTEM, 0u);
984  const BMS_CURRENT_FLOW_STATE_e flowDirection =
985  BMS_GetCurrentFlowDirection(bms_tablePackValues.stringCurrent_mA[stringNumber]);
986  bms_state.contactorToBeOpened = BMS_GetFirstContactorToBeOpened(stringNumber, flowDirection);
987  bms_state.stringToBeOpened = stringNumber;
988  /* Open first contactor */
989  CONT_OpenContactor(bms_state.stringToBeOpened, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
990  bms_state.timer = BMS_WAIT_TIME_AFTER_OPENING_STRING_CONTACTOR;
991  bms_state.substate = BMS_OPEN_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR;
992  }
993  }
994  break;
995  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_OPEN_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR) {
996  /* Check if first contactor has been opened correctly */
997  contactorState = CONT_GetContactorState(bms_state.stringToBeOpened, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
998  contactorFeedbackValid =
999  BMS_IsContactorFeedbackValid(bms_state.stringToBeOpened, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
1000  /* If we want to open the contactors because of a feedback
1001  * error for this contactor, the statement will never be true.
1002  * Thus, also continue if a feedback error for this contactor
1003  * is detected as we are not able to get a valid feedback
1004  * information at this point */
1005  if ((contactorState == CONT_SWITCH_OFF) || (contactorFeedbackValid == false)) {
1006  /* First contactor opened correctly.
1007  * Open second contactor. Pass first opened contactor into function */
1008  bms_state.contactorToBeOpened =
1009  BMS_GetSecondContactorToBeOpened(stringNumber, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
1010  /* Open second contactor */
1011  CONT_OpenContactor(bms_state.stringToBeOpened, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
1012  bms_state.timer = BMS_WAIT_TIME_AFTER_OPENING_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1013  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1014  } else {
1015  /* String not opened, re-issue closing request */
1016  CONT_OpenContactor(bms_state.stringToBeOpened, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
1017  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1018  /* TODO: add timeout */
1019  }
1020  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR) {
1021  /* Check if second contactor has been opened correctly */
1022  contactorState = CONT_GetContactorState(bms_state.stringToBeOpened, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
1023  contactorFeedbackValid =
1024  BMS_IsContactorFeedbackValid(bms_state.stringToBeOpened, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
1025  /* If we want to open the contactors because of a feedback
1026  * error for this contactor, the statement will never be true.
1027  * Thus, also continue if a feedback error for this contactor
1028  * is detected as we are not able to get a valid feedback
1029  * information at this point */
1030  if ((contactorState == CONT_SWITCH_OFF) || (contactorFeedbackValid == false)) {
1031  /* Opening for this string finished. Reset state variables used for opening */
1032  bms_state.contactorToBeOpened = CONT_UNDEFINED;
1033  bms_state.stringToBeOpened = 0u;
1034  /* String opened. Decrement string counter */
1035  if (bms_state.numberOfClosedStrings > 0u) {
1036  bms_state.numberOfClosedStrings--;
1037  }
1038  bms_state.closedStrings[stringNumber] = 0u;
1039  if (stringNumber > 0u) {
1040  /* Not all strings opened yet -> open next string */
1041  stringNumber--;
1042  bms_state.substate = BMS_OPEN_FIRST_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1043  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1044  break;
1045  } else {
1046  /* All strings opened -> prepare to leave state BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS */
1047  bms_state.substate = BMS_OPEN_STRINGS_EXIT;
1048  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1049  }
1050  break;
1051  } else if (bms_state.stringOpenTimeout == 0u) {
1052  /* String takes too long to open, go to next string */
1053  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1054  bms_state.substate = BMS_OPEN_FIRST_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1055  break;
1056  } else {
1057  /* String not opened, re-issue closing request */
1058  CONT_OpenContactor(bms_state.stringToBeOpened, bms_state.contactorToBeOpened);
1059  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1060  break;
1061  }
1062  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_OPEN_STRINGS_EXIT) {
1063  if (bms_state.nextstate == BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY) {
1064  /* Opening due to STANDBY request -> switch to BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY */
1065  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1066  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY;
1067  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1068  break;
1069  } else {
1070  /* Opening due to detected error -> switch to BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR */
1071  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1072  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1073  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1074  }
1075  } else {
1076  FAS_ASSERT(FAS_TRAP);
1077  }
1078  break;
1079 
1080  /****************************STANDBY**********************************/
1081  case BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY:
1082  BMS_SAVELASTSTATES();
1083  if (bms_state.substate == BMS_ENTRY) {
1084  BAL_SetStateRequest(BAL_STATE_ALLOWBALANCING_REQUEST);
1085 #if BS_STANDBY_PERIODIC_OPEN_WIRE_CHECK == TRUE
1086  nextOpenWireCheck = timestamp + BS_STANDBY_OPEN_WIRE_PERIOD_ms;
1087 #endif /* BS_STANDBY_PERIODIC_OPEN_WIRE_CHECK == TRUE */
1088  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_MEDIUMTIME;
1089  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS_INTERLOCK;
1090  DATA_READ_DATA(&systemstate);
1091  systemstate.bmsCanState = BMS_CANSTATE_STANDBY;
1092  DATA_WRITE_DATA(&systemstate);
1093  break;
1094  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS_INTERLOCK) {
1095  if (BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay() == STD_NOT_OK) {
1096  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1097  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1098  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1099  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1100  break;
1101  } else {
1102  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1103  bms_state.substate = BMS_INTERLOCK_CHECKED;
1104  break;
1105  }
1106  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_INTERLOCK_CHECKED) {
1107  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1108  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS;
1109  break;
1110  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS) {
1111  if (BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay() == STD_NOT_OK) {
1112  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1113  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1114  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1115  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1116  break;
1117  } else {
1118  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1119  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS;
1120  break;
1121  }
1122  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS) {
1123  if (BMS_CheckCanRequests() == BMS_REQ_ID_NORMAL) {
1124  bms_state.powerPath = BMS_POWER_PATH_0;
1125  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_DISCHARGE;
1126  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1127  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_PRECHARGE;
1128  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1129  break;
1130  }
1131  if (BMS_CheckCanRequests() == BMS_REQ_ID_CHARGE) {
1132  bms_state.powerPath = BMS_POWER_PATH_1;
1133  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_CHARGE;
1134  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1135  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_PRECHARGE;
1136  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1137  break;
1138  } else {
1139 #if BS_STANDBY_PERIODIC_OPEN_WIRE_CHECK == TRUE
1140  if (nextOpenWireCheck <= timestamp) {
1141  MEAS_RequestOpenWireCheck();
1142  nextOpenWireCheck = timestamp + BS_STANDBY_OPEN_WIRE_PERIOD_ms;
1143  }
1144 #endif /* BS_STANDBY_PERIODIC_OPEN_WIRE_CHECK == TRUE */
1145  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1146  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS;
1147  break;
1148  }
1149  } else {
1150  FAS_ASSERT(FAS_TRAP);
1151  }
1152  break;
1153 
1154  /****************************PRECHARGE********************************/
1155  case BMS_STATEMACH_PRECHARGE:
1156  BMS_SAVELASTSTATES();
1157 
1158  if (bms_state.substate == BMS_ENTRY) {
1159  DATA_READ_DATA(&systemstate);
1160  systemstate.bmsCanState = BMS_CANSTATE_PRECHARGE;
1161  DATA_WRITE_DATA(&systemstate);
1162  if (bms_state.nextstate == BMS_STATEMACH_CHARGE) {
1163  stringNumber = BMS_GetLowestString(BMS_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT, &bms_tablePackValues);
1164  } else {
1165  stringNumber = BMS_GetHighestString(BMS_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT, &bms_tablePackValues);
1166  }
1167  if (stringNumber == BMS_NO_STRING_AVAILABLE) {
1168  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1169  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1170  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1171  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1172  break;
1173  }
1174  bms_state.firstClosedString = stringNumber;
1175  if (bms_state.OscillationTimeout == 0u) {
1176  /* Close MINUS string contactor */
1177  if (CONT_CloseContactor(bms_state.firstClosedString, CONT_MINUS) == STD_OK) {
1178  bms_state.stringCloseTimeout = BMS_STRING_CLOSE_TIMEOUT;
1179  bms_state.timer = BMS_WAIT_TIME_AFTER_CLOSING_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1180  bms_state.substate = BMS_PRECHARGE_CLOSE_PRECHARGE;
1181  } else {
1182  /* Invalid contactor requested */
1183  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1184  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1185  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1186  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1187  }
1188  } else if (BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay() == STD_NOT_OK) {
1189  /* If precharge re-enter timeout not elapsed, wait (and check errors while waiting) */
1190  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1191  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1192  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1193  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1194  break;
1195  }
1196  break;
1197  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_PRECHARGE_CLOSE_PRECHARGE) {
1198  /* Check if MINUS contactor has been successfully closed */
1199  contactorState = CONT_GetContactorState(bms_state.firstClosedString, CONT_MINUS);
1200  if (contactorState == CONT_SWITCH_ON) {
1201  bms_state.OscillationTimeout = BMS_OSCILLATION_TIMEOUT;
1202  contRetVal = CONT_ClosePrecharge(bms_state.firstClosedString);
1203  bms_state.closedPrechargeContactors[stringNumber] = 1u;
1204  if (contRetVal == STD_OK) {
1205  bms_state.timer = BMS_TIME_WAIT_AFTER_CLOSING_PRECHARGE;
1206  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS_CLOSINGPRECHARGE;
1207  bms_state.PrechargeTryCounter = 0u;
1208  } else {
1209  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1210  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1211  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1212  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1213  }
1214  } else if (bms_state.stringCloseTimeout == 0u) {
1215  /* String takes too long to close */
1216  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1217  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1218  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1219  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1220  } else {
1221  /* String not closed, re-issue closing request */
1222  CONT_CloseContactor(bms_state.firstClosedString, CONT_MINUS);
1223  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1224  }
1225  break;
1226  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS_CLOSINGPRECHARGE) {
1227  if (BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay() == STD_NOT_OK) {
1228  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1229  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1230  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1231  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1232  break;
1233  } else {
1234  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1235  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS;
1236  break;
1237  }
1238  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS) {
1239  if (BMS_CheckCanRequests() == BMS_REQ_ID_STANDBY) {
1240  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1241  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1242  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY;
1243  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1244  break;
1245  } else {
1246  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1247  bms_state.substate = BMS_PRECHARGE_CHECK_VOLTAGES;
1248  }
1249  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_PRECHARGE_CHECK_VOLTAGES) {
1250  contactorState = CONT_GetContactorState(bms_state.firstClosedString, CONT_PRECHARGE);
1251  retVal = BMS_CheckPrecharge(bms_state.firstClosedString, &bms_tablePackValues);
1252  /* Check if precharge contactor is closed and precharge is finished */
1253  if ((contactorState == CONT_SWITCH_ON) && (retVal == STD_OK)) {
1254  /* Successfully precharged. Close string PLUS contactor */
1255  CONT_CloseContactor(bms_state.firstClosedString, CONT_PLUS);
1256  bms_state.stringCloseTimeout = BMS_STRING_CLOSE_TIMEOUT;
1257  bms_state.timer = BMS_WAIT_TIME_AFTER_CLOSING_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1258  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_CLOSE_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR_PRECHARGE_STATE;
1259  break;
1260  } else {
1261  /* Precharging failed. Open precharge contactor. */
1262  contRetVal = CONT_OpenPrecharge(bms_state.firstClosedString);
1263  /* Check if retry limit has been reached */
1264  if (bms_state.PrechargeTryCounter < (BMS_PRECHARGE_TRIES - 1u)) {
1265  bms_state.closedPrechargeContactors[stringNumber] = 0u;
1266  if (contRetVal == STD_OK) {
1267  bms_state.timer = BMS_TIME_WAIT_AFTERPRECHARGEFAIL;
1268  bms_state.substate = BMS_PRECHARGE_CLOSE_PRECHARGE;
1269  bms_state.PrechargeTryCounter++;
1270  } else {
1271  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1272  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1273  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1274  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1275  }
1276  break;
1277  } else {
1278  bms_state.closedPrechargeContactors[stringNumber] = 0u;
1279  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1280  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1281  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1282  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1283  break;
1284  }
1285  }
1286  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_CLOSE_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR_PRECHARGE_STATE) {
1287  contactorState = CONT_GetContactorState(bms_state.firstClosedString, CONT_PLUS);
1288  if (contactorState == CONT_SWITCH_ON) {
1289  bms_state.closedStrings[bms_state.firstClosedString] = 1u;
1290  bms_state.numberOfClosedStrings++;
1291  bms_state.timer = BMS_WAIT_TIME_AFTER_CLOSING_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1292  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS_PRECHARGE_CLOSINGSTRINGS;
1293  break;
1294  } else if (bms_state.stringCloseTimeout == 0u) {
1295  /* String takes too long to close */
1296  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1297  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1298  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1299  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1300  break;
1301  } else {
1302  /* String not closed, re-issue closing request */
1303  CONT_CloseContactor(bms_state.firstClosedString, CONT_PLUS);
1304  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1305  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS_PRECHARGE_FIRST_STRING;
1306  break;
1307  }
1308  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS_PRECHARGE_FIRST_STRING) {
1309  if (BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay() == STD_NOT_OK) {
1310  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1311  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1312  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1313  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1314  break;
1315  } else {
1316  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1317  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_CLOSE_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR_PRECHARGE_STATE;
1318  break;
1319  }
1320  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS_PRECHARGE_CLOSINGSTRINGS) {
1321  /* Always make one error check after the first string was closed successfully */
1322  if (BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay() == STD_NOT_OK) {
1323  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1324  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1325  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1326  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1327  break;
1328  } else {
1329  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1330  bms_state.substate = BMS_PRECHARGE_OPEN_PRECHARGE;
1331  break;
1332  }
1333  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_PRECHARGE_OPEN_PRECHARGE) {
1334  contRetVal = CONT_OpenPrecharge(bms_state.firstClosedString);
1335  if (contRetVal == STD_OK) {
1336  bms_state.closedPrechargeContactors[stringNumber] = 0u;
1337  bms_state.timer = BMS_TIME_WAIT_AFTER_OPENING_PRECHARGE;
1338  bms_state.substate = BMS_PRECHARGE_CHECK_OPEN_PRECHARGE;
1339  } else {
1340  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1341  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1342  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1343  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1344  }
1345  break;
1346  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_PRECHARGE_CHECK_OPEN_PRECHARGE) {
1347  contactorState = CONT_GetContactorState(bms_state.firstClosedString, CONT_PRECHARGE);
1348  if (contactorState == CONT_SWITCH_OFF) {
1349  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1350  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_NORMAL;
1351  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1352  break;
1353  } else if (bms_state.stringCloseTimeout == 0u) {
1354  /* Precharge contactor takes too long to open */
1355  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1356  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1357  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1358  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1359  break;
1360  } else {
1361  /* Precharge contactor not opened, re-issue open request */
1362  CONT_OpenPrecharge(bms_state.firstClosedString);
1363  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1364  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS_PRECHARGE_FIRST_STRING;
1365  break;
1366  }
1367  } else {
1368  FAS_ASSERT(FAS_TRAP);
1369  }
1370  break;
1371 
1372  /****************************NORMAL**************************************/
1373  case BMS_STATEMACH_NORMAL:
1374  BMS_SAVELASTSTATES();
1375 
1376  if (bms_state.substate == BMS_ENTRY) {
1377 #if BS_NORMAL_PERIODIC_OPEN_WIRE_CHECK == TRUE
1378  nextOpenWireCheck = timestamp + BS_NORMAL_OPEN_WIRE_PERIOD_ms;
1379 #endif /* BS_NORMAL_PERIODIC_OPEN_WIRE_CHECK == TRUE */
1380  DATA_READ_DATA(&systemstate);
1381  if (bms_state.nextstate == BMS_STATEMACH_CHARGE) {
1382  systemstate.bmsCanState = BMS_CANSTATE_CHARGE;
1383  } else {
1384  systemstate.bmsCanState = BMS_CANSTATE_NORMAL;
1385  }
1386  DATA_WRITE_DATA(&systemstate);
1387  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1388  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS;
1389  bms_state.nextstringclosedtimer = 0u;
1390  break;
1391  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS) {
1392  if (BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay() == STD_NOT_OK) {
1393  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1394  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1395  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1396  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1397  break;
1398  } else {
1399  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1400  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS;
1401  break;
1402  }
1403  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS) {
1404  if (BMS_CheckCanRequests() == BMS_REQ_ID_STANDBY) {
1405  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1406  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1407  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY;
1408  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1409  break;
1410  } else {
1411 #if BS_NORMAL_PERIODIC_OPEN_WIRE_CHECK == TRUE
1412  if (nextOpenWireCheck <= timestamp) {
1413  MEAS_RequestOpenWireCheck();
1414  nextOpenWireCheck = timestamp + BS_NORMAL_OPEN_WIRE_PERIOD_ms;
1415  }
1416 #endif /* BS_NORMAL_PERIODIC_OPEN_WIRE_CHECK == TRUE */
1417  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1418  bms_state.substate = BMS_NORMAL_CLOSE_NEXT_STRING;
1419  break;
1420  }
1421  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_NORMAL_CLOSE_NEXT_STRING) {
1422  if (bms_state.nextstringclosedtimer == 0u) {
1423  nextStringNumber =
1424  BMS_GetClosestString(BMS_DO_NOT_TAKE_PRECHARGE_INTO_ACCCOUNT, &bms_tablePackValues);
1425  if (nextStringNumber == BMS_NO_STRING_AVAILABLE) {
1426  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1427  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS;
1428  break;
1429  } else if (
1430  (BMS_GetStringVoltageDifference(nextStringNumber, &bms_tablePackValues) <=
1431  BMS_NEXT_STRING_VOLTAGE_LIMIT_MV) &&
1432  (BMS_GetAverageStringCurrent(&bms_tablePackValues) <= BMS_AVERAGE_STRING_CURRENT_LIMIT_MA)) {
1433  /* Voltage/current conditions suitable to close a further string. Close first string contactor */
1434  CONT_CloseContactor(nextStringNumber, CONT_MINUS);
1435  bms_state.nextstringclosedtimer = BMS_STRING_CLOSE_TIMEOUT;
1436  bms_state.timer = BMS_WAIT_TIME_AFTER_CLOSING_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1437  bms_state.substate = BMS_NORMAL_CLOSE_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1438  break;
1439  }
1440  } else {
1441  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1442  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS;
1443  break;
1444  }
1445  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_NORMAL_CLOSE_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR) {
1446  contactorState = CONT_GetContactorState(nextStringNumber, CONT_MINUS);
1447  if (contactorState == CONT_SWITCH_ON) {
1448  /* First string contactor closed. Close second string contactor */
1449  CONT_CloseContactor(nextStringNumber, CONT_PLUS);
1450  bms_state.timer = BMS_WAIT_TIME_AFTER_CLOSING_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1451  bms_state.substate = BMS_NORMAL_CLOSE_SECOND_STRING_CONTACTOR;
1452  } else if (bms_state.stringCloseTimeout == 0u) {
1453  /* String takes too long to close */
1454  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1455  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1456  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1457  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1458  break;
1459  } else {
1460  /* String minus contactor has not been closed successfully. Re-trigger closing */
1461  CONT_CloseContactor(nextStringNumber, CONT_MINUS);
1462  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1463  }
1464  break;
1465  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_STRING_CLOSED) {
1466  contactorState = CONT_GetContactorState(nextStringNumber, CONT_PLUS);
1467  if (contactorState == CONT_SWITCH_ON) {
1468  bms_state.numberOfClosedStrings++;
1469  bms_state.closedStrings[nextStringNumber] = 1u;
1470  bms_state.nextstringclosedtimer = BMS_WAIT_TIME_BETWEEN_CLOSING_STRINGS;
1471  /* Go to begin of NORMAL case to redo the full procedure with error check and request check */
1472  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS;
1473  break;
1474  } else if (bms_state.stringCloseTimeout == 0u) {
1475  /* String takes too long to close */
1476  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1477  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1478  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1479  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1480  break;
1481  } else if (BMS_IsBatterySystemStateOkay() == STD_NOT_OK) {
1482  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1483  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1484  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR;
1485  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1486  break;
1487  } else if (BMS_CheckCanRequests() == BMS_REQ_ID_STANDBY) {
1488  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1489  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1490  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY;
1491  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1492  break;
1493  } else {
1494  /* String not closed, re-issue closing request */
1495  CONT_CloseContactor(nextStringNumber, CONT_PLUS);
1496  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1497  break;
1498  }
1499  } else {
1500  FAS_ASSERT(FAS_TRAP);
1501  }
1502  break;
1503 
1504  /****************************ERROR*************************************/
1505  case BMS_STATEMACH_ERROR:
1506  BMS_SAVELASTSTATES();
1507 
1508  if (bms_state.substate == BMS_ENTRY) {
1509  /* Set BMS System state to error */
1510  DATA_READ_DATA(&systemstate);
1511  systemstate.bmsCanState = BMS_CANSTATE_ERROR;
1512  DATA_WRITE_DATA(&systemstate);
1513  /* Deactivate balancing */
1514  BAL_SetStateRequest(BAL_STATE_NO_BALANCING_REQUEST);
1515  /* Change LED toggle frequency to indicate an error */
1516  LED_SetToggleTime(LED_ERROR_OPERATION_ON_OFF_TIME_ms);
1517  /* Set timer for next open wire check */
1518  nextOpenWireCheck = timestamp + AFE_ERROR_OPEN_WIRE_PERIOD_ms;
1519  /* Switch to next substate */
1520  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1521  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS;
1522  break;
1523  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS) {
1524  if (DIAG_IsAnyFatalErrorSet() == true) {
1525  /* we stay already in requested state */
1526  if (nextOpenWireCheck <= timestamp) {
1527  /* Perform open-wire check periodically */
1528  /* MEAS_RequestOpenWireCheck(); */ /*TODO: check with strings */
1529  nextOpenWireCheck = timestamp + AFE_ERROR_OPEN_WIRE_PERIOD_ms;
1530  }
1531  } else {
1532  /* No error detected anymore - reset fatal error related variables */
1533  bms_state.minimumActiveDelay_ms = BMS_NO_ACTIVE_DELAY_TIME_ms;
1534  bms_state.minimumActiveDelay_ms = BMS_NO_ACTIVE_DELAY_TIME_ms;
1535  bms_state.transitionToErrorState = false;
1536  /* Check for STANDBY request */
1537  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1538  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS;
1539  break;
1540  }
1541  } else if (bms_state.substate == BMS_CHECK_STATE_REQUESTS) {
1542  if (BMS_CheckCanRequests() == BMS_REQ_ID_STANDBY) {
1543  /* Activate balancing again */
1544  BAL_SetStateRequest(BAL_STATE_ALLOWBALANCING_REQUEST);
1545  /* Set LED frequency to normal operation as we leave error
1546  state subsequently */
1547  LED_SetToggleTime(LED_NORMAL_OPERATION_ON_OFF_TIME_ms);
1548 
1549  /* Verify that all contactors are opened and switch to
1550  * STANDBY state afterwards */
1551  bms_state.state = BMS_STATEMACH_OPEN_CONTACTORS;
1552  bms_state.nextstate = BMS_STATEMACH_STANDBY;
1553  bms_state.substate = BMS_ENTRY;
1554  break;
1555  } else {
1556  bms_state.timer = BMS_STATEMACH_SHORTTIME;
1557  bms_state.substate = BMS_CHECK_ERROR_FLAGS;
1558  break;
1559  }
1560  } else {
1561  /* invalid state -> this should never be reached */
1562  FAS_ASSERT(FAS_TRAP);
1563  }
1564  break;
1565  default:
1566  /* invalid state */
1567  FAS_ASSERT(FAS_TRAP);
1568  break;
1569  } /* end switch (bms_state.state) */
1570 
1571  bms_state.triggerentry--;
1572  bms_state.counter++;
1573 }
1574 
1575 extern BMS_CURRENT_FLOW_STATE_e BMS_GetBatterySystemState(void) {
1576  return bms_state.currentFlowState;
1577 }
1578 
1579 extern BMS_CURRENT_FLOW_STATE_e BMS_GetCurrentFlowDirection(int32_t current_mA) {
1580  /* AXIVION Routine Generic-MissingParameterAssert: current_mA: parameter accepts whole range */
1581  BMS_CURRENT_FLOW_STATE_e retVal = BMS_DISCHARGING;
1582 
1583  if (BS_POSITIVE_DISCHARGE_CURRENT == true) {
1584  if (current_mA >= BS_REST_CURRENT_mA) {
1585  retVal = BMS_DISCHARGING;
1586  } else if (current_mA <= -BS_REST_CURRENT_mA) {
1587  retVal = BMS_CHARGING;
1588  } else {
1589  retVal = BMS_AT_REST;
1590  }
1591  } else {
1592  if (current_mA <= -BS_REST_CURRENT_mA) {
1593  retVal = BMS_DISCHARGING;
1594  } else if (current_mA >= BS_REST_CURRENT_mA) {
1595  retVal = BMS_CHARGING;
1596  } else {
1597  retVal = BMS_AT_REST;
1598  }
1599  }
1600  return retVal;
1601 }
1602 
1603 extern bool BMS_IsStringClosed(uint8_t stringNumber) {
1604  FAS_ASSERT(stringNumber < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS);
1605  bool retval = false;
1606  if (bms_state.closedStrings[stringNumber] == 1u) {
1607  retval = true;
1608  }
1609  return retval;
1610 }
1611 
1612 extern bool BMS_IsStringPrecharging(uint8_t stringNumber) {
1613  FAS_ASSERT(stringNumber < BS_NR_OF_STRINGS);
1614  bool retval = false;
1615  if (bms_state.closedPrechargeContactors[stringNumber] == 1u) {
1616  retval = true;
1617  }
1618  return retval;
1619 }
